Description: Body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery broad neck-amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of pair of horses drawing chariot (part of neck, shoulder, body, rump, tail and harness of near horse, with mane, chest strap and reins in added red; two rows of dots in added white on decorative collar; the far horse is shown only by the fine line in white running along the top of the near horse’s back), to left.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Brussels M831 and Athens National Museum 5610 in Samos VI.I. Bonn 1973, pl. 119, no. 976a and b.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.19)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 21, pl. VII, no. 7)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 132, no. 28)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.253, no.13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.028) (Phase 1)
